biography.value:
Centuries ago, the dragon Shadrix Silverquill mastered the magic of light and shadow, and he focused that magic through communication. Shadrixâ€™s words thrummed with power, inspiring his allies and demoralizing his enemies.

He established Silverquill College on the principles of eloquence and leadership, seeking to produce leaders who would go forth to guide others.

description.value:
Shadrix makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d10 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 1d8 type=radiant average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage. If the target is a creature, it is wracked with despair and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Shadrix exhales an entwined burst of blinding radiance and unnerving shadow in a 90-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Each creature in that area must make a [[/save con 21 format=long]]. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/damage 7d8 type=radiant average=true]] damage and [[/damage 7d8 type=psychic average=true]] damage and is &Reference[blinded]{blinded} until the start of Shadrixâ€™s next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isnâ€™t &Reference[blinded]{blinded}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Shadrix casts one of the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[cha]{Charisma} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 23):

1/day each: darkness, daylight, hypnotic pattern, sending, suggestion

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage. If the target is a creature, it is wracked with despair and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Shadrix can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creatureâ€™s turn. Shadrix regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Claw. Shadrix makes one Claw attack.

Shadow Slip (Costs 2 Actions). Shadrix becomes an inky cloud of shadow and can move up to half his flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks, then resumes his true form. During this movement, he can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If he moves through a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save con 21 format=long]] or become &Reference[blinded]{blinded} until the end of its next turn. If Shadrix ends this move inside an object, he takes [[/damage 1d10 type=force average=true]] damage and is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space.

Flash of Inspiration (Costs 3 Actions). Shadrix magically summons 1d4 inkling mascot;inkling mascots in unoccupied spaces he can see within 60 feet of himself. The inklings obey his commands and take their turns immediately after his. While any of these inklings live, Shadrix has advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. These inklings disappear after 10 minutes, when Shadrix dies, or when he uses this action again.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Shadrix becomes an inky cloud of shadow and can move up to half his flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks, then resumes his true form. During this movement, he can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If he moves through a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save con 21 format=long]] or become &Reference[blinded]{blinded} until the end of its next turn. If Shadrix ends this move inside an object, he takes [[/damage 1d10 type=force average=true]] damage and is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Shadrix magically summons 1d4 inkling mascot;inkling mascots in unoccupied spaces he can see within 60 feet of himself. The inklings obey his commands and take their turns immediately after his. While any of these inklings live, Shadrix has advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. These inklings disappear after 10 minutes, when Shadrix dies, or when he uses this action again.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If Shadrix fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with &Reference[darkvision]{darkvision} can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

A 60-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} of light spreads out from a point you choose within range. The &Reference[sphere]{sphere} is bright light and sheds dim light for an additional 60 feet.

If you chose a point on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the light shines from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the affected object with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the light.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of darkness created by a spell of 3rd level or lower, the spell that created the darkness is dispelled.

You create a twisting pattern of colors that weaves through the air inside a 30-foot &Reference[cube]{cube} within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who sees the pattern must make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes &Reference[charmed]{charmed} for the duration. While &Reference[charmed]{charmed} by this spell, the creature is &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated} and has a speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

You send a short message of twenty-five words or less to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables creatures with &Reference[int]{Intelligence} scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message.

You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a 5 percent chance that the message doesn't arrive.

You suggest a course of activity (limited to a sentence or two) and magically influence a creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. Creatures that can't be &Reference[charmed]{charmed} are immune to this effect. The suggestion must be worded in such a manner as to make the course of action sound reasonable. Asking the creature to stab itself, throw itself onto a spear, immolate itself, or do some other obviously harmful act ends the spell.

The target must make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw. On a failed save, it pursues the course of action you described to the best of its ability. The suggested course of action can continue for the entire duration. If the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends when the subject finishes what it was asked to do.

You can also specify conditions that will trigger a special activity during the duration. For example, you might suggest that a knight give her warhorse to the first beggar she meets. If the condition isn't met before the spell expires, the activity isn't performed.

If you or any of your companions damage the target, the spell ends.
